definition: نجد najada i (najd) to help, aid, assist, support (ه s.o.), stand by s.o. (ه), najida a (najad) to sweat, perspire II to furnish (هـ s.th.); to upholster (هـ s.th.), to comb, card, tease (القطن al-quṭna cotton) III = najada IV = najada; to travel in the highland (of Arabia) X to ask for help (ه s.o.), appeal for help) to s.o.), seek aid (ه or ب from s.o.), to take liberties, make bold (على with s.o.) ه 943 نجد najd pl. نجاد nijād highland, upland, tableland, plateau; the Arabian highland, Nejd
